sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The secrets of angling Teaching, the choisest tooles baytes and seasons, for the taking of any fish, in pond or riuer: practised and familiarly opened in three bookes. By I.D. Esquire. Dennys, John, d. 1609.
[62] p.
[T. Snodham] for R. Jackson, [London : 1613]
I.D. = John Dennys. Printer's name from STC. Woodcut title vignette. In verse. E4, final leaf, is blank. Signatures: A⁴ B-D E⁴ (-A1, blank?). Imperfect; A2, title page, shaved, with loss of imprint (supplied by STC). Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
=======

[62] p.
[T. Snodham] for R. Jackson, [London : 1613]
I.D. = John Dennys. Printer's name from STC. Woodcut title vignette. In verse. E4, final leaf, is blank. Signatures: A⁴ B-D E⁴ (-A1, blank?). Imperfect; A2, title page, shaved, with loss of imprint (supplied by STC). Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
R. Jackson
